summary: This bill, the Defending Domestic Orange Juice Production Act of 2025, aims to modify the federal standards for pasteurized orange juice. It mandates that finished pasteurized orange juice contain a minimum of 10.0% by weight of orange juice soluble solids, excluding any added sweetening ingredients. The bill clarifies that this amendment doesn't limit the Secretary of Health and Human Services' authority to revise orange juice standards. This legislation was introduced in the House of Representatives on February 4, 2025.
